title: rustdoc: Documentation exposes the original private name instead of the public one

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
mod facade {
    pub struct Facade {}

    impl Facade {
        pub fn foo() {}
    }
}

pub use facade::Facade as Server;
```

When running `rustdoc`, and exposing some `Struct` publicly with a different name than they were defined, the `impl` documentation is using those names that aren't exposed.

![Screenshot_20210420_125004](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1161224/115384806-bdd7a900-a1d7-11eb-8fcd-1e36ca6651f1.png)

Documentation should use the public names, nor the original names, since they aren't visible for crate consumers.


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 2fd73fabe469357a12c2c974c140f67e7cdd76d0
commit-date: 2021-03-23
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.51.0
LLVM version: 11.0.1
```

Originally was filled as https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/9380.
